means: 挖掘的工作，基本研究，费力的基础工作

sentence.Network_en: It is now that the spadework has to be done to lay firm foundations for later success.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在应该着手做一些准备工作以便为日后的成功打下坚实基础。

sentence.Network_en: She got the praise for the job but he did all the spadework.
sentence.Network_cn: 工作完成后她获得赞誉,但筹备期间的苦活儿全是他干的.

sentence.Network_en: Next time, do a little spadework.
sentence.Network_cn: 下次应该做一点准备工作.

entry.tran: (计划、活动等开始之前需要做的)艰苦枯燥的准备工作
entry.def: The spadework is the uninteresting work that has to be done as preparation before you can start a project or activity.

example.ex: It is now that the spadework has to be done to lay firm foundations for later success.
example.tran: 现在应该着手做一些准备工作以便为日后的成功打下坚实基础。

means.word_mean: 1. dull or routine preliminary work preparing for an undertaking

auth_sentence.content: Dvashun, when others do all the spadework, 'little digs' are all that Neal T can manage!
